snippet.textDisplay: One of the best games I've ever played. SMT > FF right now.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the best games I've ever played. SMT > FF right now.

snippet.textDisplay: WOOH listen to that guitar scream!
snippet.textOriginal: WOOH listen to that guitar scream!

snippet.textDisplay: I still remember how I came about this game. A few years ago I was just searching online for some new video game music. I stumbled upon an unknown website and also found out about Y's music too, actually. Boss Battle was the first track I ever heard from SMT:N, and I just loved it. From that day forward I was totally into Meguro's work and how I've grown to love all SMT titles.
snippet.textOriginal: I still remember how I came about this game. A few years ago I was just searching online for some new video game music. I stumbled upon an unknown website and also found out about Y's music too, actually. Boss Battle was the first track I ever heard from SMT:N, and I just loved it. From that day forward I was totally into Meguro's work and how I've grown to love all SMT titles.

snippet.textDisplay: @SanRok Shoji is a fantastic composer, never fails to impress me.
snippet.textOriginal: @SanRok Shoji is a fantastic composer, never fails to impress me.

snippet.textDisplay: As a guy who's finished SMT...once...on the DS, I have to ask: "are all SMT games this hard and punishing for your RPG habits?".
snippet.textOriginal: As a guy who's finished SMT...once...on the DS, I have to ask: "are all SMT games this hard and punishing for your RPG habits?".

snippet.textDisplay: Was it Strange Journey?
snippet.textOriginal: Was it Strange Journey?

snippet.textDisplay: No, the devil survivor games are actually pretty easy.

snippet.textDisplay: Most demons do end up recurring through different Shin Megami Tensei games, although a lot of times in different forms.

snippet.textDisplay: Nocturne was da best. So happy he came back as a bonus boss and spent his time casually rocking your party with Gaea Rage.

snippet.textDisplay: I think Persona 4 was more of a grindfest. WIth Persona 3:FES, I kinda found a strategy and was able to succeed with it. In P4, the main thing that through me off was that you had to pay a HUGE amount of money to heal when in dungeons, limiting how much you could level up per day.
snippet.textOriginal: I think Persona 4 was more of a grindfest. WIth Persona 3:FES, I kinda found a strategy and was able to succeed with it. In P4, the main thing that through me off was that you had to pay a HUGE amount of money to heal when in dungeons, limiting how much you could level up per day.

snippet.textDisplay: Smt games are the absolute best. They delve into subjects no other form of literature (movie game or book) will touch and the music and story are unparalelled. The gameplay is usually fun as hell too. Im going to order this game, just recently beat P4 and have beat P3FES. Cant wait for Persona1 remake on PsP!!!!
snippet.textOriginal: Smt games are the absolute best. They delve into subjects no other form of literature (movie game or book) will touch and the music and story are unparalelled. The gameplay is usually fun as hell too. Im going to order this game, just recently beat P4 and have beat P3FES. Cant wait for Persona1 remake on PsP!!!!
